result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael John Ellis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court withholds sentence 2 years probation conditions of probation, 150 days county jail with huber credit eff 11-4-14, for 88 days,   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan. revoke dl  27  months plus 150 days   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.  IID for  27  months  On any vehicle owned or operated effective  12-19-2014 .    Absolute Sobriety    No drug use without a valid prescription.   Fine / costs $1694.00    Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.  dismiss and read-in 14CF112

IID for  27  months  On any vehicle owned or operated effective  12-19-2014 .    Absolute Sobriety    No drug use without a valid prescription. supervisions.notes: 8 months county jail with huber; credit for 178 days; 30 days to set up a payment plan for unpaid fines which were converted from DOC to clerk collect with civil judgment.  IF DE SHOWS PROOF OF VALID DRIVERS LICENSE WITHIN 6 MONTHS OF TODAY CLERK TO CREDIT $350 OF FINE FORFEITURE.  If one day after 6 months no credit.

Defendant Michael John Ellis in court, in custody.   Assistant District Attorney John Yackel for the State.  Attorney Sheila Yohnk for Jesse Johansen.   Defendant never went to probation.   Unpaid court obligations converted to civil judgment.  8 months county jail with huber; credit for time served 178 days.  30 days to set up payment plan.  If defendant can show the Clerk of Court a valid drivers license within 6 months there will be a $350 credit to his fines.  But if it is 6 months and 1 day there will be no credit.

$1,000 combined on 14CF69 and 14CF112
  SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Daily Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to DAILY TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 24 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
Absolute Sobriety; No consumption of alcoholic beverages; No entry upon premises of businesses that sell alcohol by the drink.

Defendant Michael John Ellis in court, in custody,  with attorney Martin Jarvis.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests bond modification to allow cosigner.  Anita Carley appears in court and agrees to co-sign bond for DEF, agrees to him being released into her custody and to be held accountable for his appearances in court and the random testing conditions of his bond. $1000 bond- $900 signature, $100 cash,  Bond combined 14CF69 & 14CF112. 
DEF pleads Not Guilty, thus entered by court.

Defendant Michael John Ellis in court, in custody.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. vacate bail forfeitue already done premature- court forfeits bail effective today, new bond $750.00  cash combined on both files with conditions SBBC,  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
for arrest of Michael John Ellis.

Defendant Michael John Ellis calls into court, but does not appear personally. John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF lives in Siren.  He called from LCO stating he was unable to get a ride to court.  Court in receipt of letter from STOP program coordinator stating DEF is not in compliance with the STOP monitoring program.  DEF is not in compliance with bond.  Court authorizes warrant for arrest and forfeiture proceedings to begin on bond.  Bail is revoked.

Defendant Michael John Ellis in court with def. atty. Martin Jarvis, today.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of complaint; waives reading of complaint; advised of rights/penalties; advised of right to prelim; waives time limits for prelim - reserves right; bond continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
